domain
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  domain.Sprite
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updatable, Collisionable, Statitzable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Animated, Inanimated
public abstract class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable, Updatable, Statitzable, Collisionable

This class acts as a game entity wich should be updated and rendered.

environment

protected Environment environment
The Environment reference for the Sprite instance

protected Media mediaManager
A Media reference to allow the Sprite playing sounds, and image animations.

The current BufferedImage that graphically represents this Sprite instance.

an ImagesAnimator instance wich is the responsible of changing the Sprite image in an animated sequence.

pointRelativeToScreen

protected java.awt.Point pointRelativeToScreen
The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the window represented by a Point.

pointRelativeToScenario

protected java.awt.Point pointRelativeToScenario
The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the Scenario instance represented by a Point.

width

protected int width
The Sprite's width

height

protected int height
The Sprite's height

zIndex

protected int zIndex
The Sprite's superposition indicator. This value is used by the Collisions class to know at wich layer a Sprite instance is. In a next release this field will be used to order the Renderable instances at the Environment.renderables ArrayList.

collisionableAreas

protected java.awt.Rectangle[] collisionableAreas
This field holds additional Rectangle instances wich can be used to detect a more accurated collisions or simply to determine any collisionable area for the Sprite instance.

visibilityRange

protected int visibilityRange
This value determines wich is the visible area for this Sprite.

Constructor Detail

Sprite

protected Sprite()
The default Sprite Constructor. It sets the relativeToScreen cordinates at 0,0 and sets the relativeToScenario = relativeToScreen. The mediaManager is initialized and the collisionableAreas too.

Sprite

protected Sprite(java.awt.Point relativeToScreen,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int zIndex)
This constructor sets the relativeToScreen cordinates at the relativeToScreen value and sets the relativeToScenario = relativeToScreen. The mediaManager is initialized and the collisionableAreas too. The width, height, and zIndex values are assigned.

Parameters:
relativeToScreen - The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the window represented by a Point.
width - The Sprite's width
height - The Sprite's height
zIndex - The Sprite's superposition indicator

Sprite

protected Sprite(java.awt.Point relativeToScreen,
                 java.awt.Point relativeToScenario,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int zIndex)
This constructor sets the relativeToScreen cordinates at the relativeToScreen value and sets the relativeToScenario at the relativeToScenario. The mediaManager is initialized and the collisionableAreas too. The width, height, and zIndex values are assigned.

Parameters:
relativeToScreen - The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the window represented by a Point.
relativeToScenario - The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the Scenario instance represented by a Point.
width - The Sprite's width
height - The Sprite's height
zIndex - The Sprite's superposition indicator

Sprite

protected Sprite(java.awt.Point relativeToScreen,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int zIndex,
                 java.awt.Rectangle[] collisionableAreas)
This constructor sets the relativeToScreen cordinates at the relativeToScreen value and sets the relativeToScenario = relativeToScreen. The mediaManager is initialized and the collisionableAreas are initialized with the collisionableAreas value. The width, height, and zIndex values are assigned.

Parameters:
relativeToScreen - The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the window represented by a Point.
width - The Sprite's width
height - The Sprite's height
zIndex - The Sprite's superposition indicator
collisionableAreas - The collisionable areas to append using the addCollisionableAreas() method.
See Also:
addCollisionableAreas(java.awt.Rectangle[])

Sprite

protected Sprite(java.awt.Point relativeToScreen,
                 java.awt.Point relativeToScenario,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int zIndex,
                 java.awt.Rectangle[] collisionableAreas)
This constructor sets the relativeToScreen cordinates at the relativeToScreen value and sets the relativeToScenario at the relativeToScenario. The mediaManager is initialized and the collisionableAreas are initialized with the collisionableAreas value. The width, height, and zIndex values are assigned.

Parameters:
relativeToScreen - The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the window represented by a Point.
relativeToScenario - The current position of the Sprite instance relative to the upper-left corner of the Scenario instance represented by a Point.
width - The Sprite's width
height - The Sprite's height
zIndex - The Sprite's superposition indicator
collisionableAreas - The collisionable areas to append using the addCollisionableAreas() method.
See Also:
addCollisionableAreas(java.awt.Rectangle[])
Method Detail

findOnScreenPosition

public java.awt.Point findOnScreenPosition(Sprite.ON_SCREEN_POSITION relativeToScreenPosition)
This method is used to help finding a Point relativeToScreen

Parameters:
relativeToScreenPosition - The position from the enumeration ON_SCREEN_POSITION from wich the Point value is requested.
Returns:
The relative to screen Point for the specified ON_SCREEN_POSITION value

render

public void render(java.awt.Graphics gr)
The implementation method for the Renderable interface. Makes the sprite drawing its current image at the pointRelativeToScreen position.

Specified by:
render in interface Renderable
Parameters:
gr - The Graphics object wich will perform the rendering.

getZIndex

public int getZIndex()
Description copied from interface: Collisionable
The zIndex indicates wich is the superposition value between collisionables. A smaller value indicates it's behind, while a bigger one indicates it's in front.

Specified by:
getZIndex in interface Collisionable
Returns:
The Sprite's superposition indicator.

public void setZIndex(int zindex)

public void setCollisionableAreas(java.awt.Rectangle[] collisionableAreas)
This method sets the current collisionableAreas Rectangle array.

Parameters:
collisionableAreas - The new collisionable areas Rectangle array. If this value is null, the method does nothing.

addCollisionableAreas

public void addCollisionableAreas(java.awt.Rectangle[] newCollisionableAreas)
This method append the newCollisionableAreas to the current collisionableAreas Rectangle array.

Parameters:
newCollisionableAreas - The Rectangle array to append to the current collisionableAreas. If it's null The method does nothing.

update

public void update()
This method implements the update() method from the Updatable interface. At this hierarchy top-level, the update method only update it's current image if an ImageAnimator has been set.

Specified by:
update in interface Updatable

getVisibleArea

public java.awt.Rectangle getVisibleArea()
Description copied from interface: Collisionable
This method should return the visible area for this collisionable instance.

Specified by:
getVisibleArea in interface Collisionable
Returns:
a Rectangle wich represents the current visible area of this Sprite instance.

setImage

public void setImage(java.lang.String imageName)
This method sets the Sprite's image. If an animator was setted, it's stopped. Then the Media instance for this Sprite is asked for the imageName named BufferedImage. Once the image is setted, then width and height are setted too.

Parameters:
imageName - The name of the ImagesManager requested image.

getVisibilityRange

public int getVisibilityRange()
Returns:
The visibilityRange value for this Sprite instance.

setVisibilityRange

public void setVisibilityRange(int visibilityRange)
This method sets the visibilityRange value.

Parameters:
visibilityRange - The desired visibilityRange.

setAnimator

public void setAnimator(java.lang.String imageName,
                        int animationPeriod,
                        double sequenceDuration,
                        boolean isRepeating)
This method sets the current animator for the Sprite. First the current animator is set to null to make the GarbageCollector taking care of flushing the old ImagesAnimator instance when it has a chance. Then, the Media instance is asked for the new ImagesAnimator.

Parameters:
imageName - The name for the ImagesManager ArrayList of BufferedImages stored.
animationPeriod -
sequenceDuration - The total
isRepeating - A boolean value indicating wether the animation sequence should be restarted if it reaches the end.

getAnimatorName

public java.lang.String getAnimatorName()
Returns:
The current animator name.

getAnimatorPosition

public int getAnimatorPosition()
Returns:
The current animator showing image position.

stopAnimator

public void stopAnimator()
This method stops the animator animation process.

resumeAnimator

public void resumeAnimator()
This method resumes the animator animation process.

restartAnimatorAtPosition

public void restartAnimatorAtPosition(int position)
This method restarts the animator animation process at a given position.

Parameters:
position - The index of the image to be first displayed at the animation sequence.

setAudioClipPlayer

public void setAudioClipPlayer(java.lang.String soundName)
This method sets the current audioClipPlayer for the Sprite. First the current audioClipPlayer is set to null to make the GarbageCollector taking care of flushing the old AudioClipPlayer instance when it has a chance. Then, the Media instance is asked for the new AudioClipPlayer.

Parameters:
soundName - The name for the SoundsManager ArrayList of AudioClips stored.

playAudioClip

public void playAudioClip()
This method makes the AudioClipPlayer instance playing an AudioClip.

See Also:
SoundsManager.AudioClipPlayer.playAudioClip()

loopAudioClip

public void loopAudioClip()
This method makes the AudioClipPlayer instance looping an AudioClip.

See Also:
SoundsManager.AudioClipPlayer.loopAudioClip()

stopAudioClip

public void stopAudioClip()
This method makes the AudioClipPlayer instance stopping an AudioClip.

See Also:
SoundsManager.AudioClipPlayer.stopAudioClip()

setClipPlayer

public void setClipPlayer(java.lang.String soundName)
This method sets the current clipPlayer for the Sprite. First the current clipPlayer is set to null to make the GarbageCollector taking care of flushing the old ClipPlayer instance when it has a chance. Then, the Media instance is asked for the new ClipPlayer.

Parameters:
soundName - The name for the SoundsManager ArrayList of Clips stored.
